Class AnimateByVelocityData

Namespace
ECCLibrary.Data
Assembly
ECCLibrary.dll

Contains data pertaining to the AnimateByVelocity component. This component sets animation parameters based on the creature's direction & velocity.

Constructors

AnimateByVelocityData(float, float, float, bool, float)

Contains data pertaining to the AnimateByVelocity component. This component sets animation parameters based on the creature's direction & velocity.

public AnimateByVelocityData(float animationMoveMaxSpeed, float animationMaxPitch = 30, float animationMaxTilt = 45, bool useStrafeAnimation = false, float dampTime = 0.5)

Parameters

animationMoveMaxSpeed float

At this speed, the Animator's "speed" parameter will be at its maximum of 1f. This should roughly match the creature's maximum velocity.

animationMaxPitch float

Pitch can be described by looking up and down. The parameter for pitch 'pitch' and is always on a scale from -1 to 1. When the creature has rotated by a pitch of animationMaxPitch in one way, it will equal 1. If it rotated the opposite direction the same amount, it would equal -1.

animationMaxTilt float

In this case, tilt is rotating left and right. This parameter has the same rules, basically, as animationMaxPitch.

useStrafeAnimation bool

Strafe animation consists of Up, Down, Left, Right, Forward, and Backwards animations, always relative to the creature's current rotation. The parameters used by this are 'speed_x'. 'speed_y', and 'speed_z', on a scale from -1 to 1. False by default.

dampTime float

A longer damp time means it takes longer for these strafe, pitch, and tilt animations to take effect, but a more smooth transition.

Fields

animationMaxPitch

Pitch can be described by looking up and down. The parameter for pitch 'pitch' and is always on a scale from -1 to 1. When the creature has rotated by a pitch of animationMaxPitch in one way, it will equal 1. If it rotated the opposite direction the same amount, it would equal -1.
